This defense generates more pressure than a middle school dance chaperone, yet somehow creates fewer turnovers than a careful baker. Three sacks a game should mean more than two picks all season.
Dan Quinn has them playing complementary football - the offense complements the defense by refusing to convert third downs, and the defense complements right back by forgetting interceptions exist.
They're the NFL equivalent of a group project where one person does all the work - the run game carries everything while the passing game shows up late with Starbucks.
